Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.cps.components

Class ContinuationExamples

  • java.lang.Object

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentI
    public class ContinuationExamples
extends AbstractComponent
    The class ContinuationExamples implements a component for illustrating the use of BCM continuation-passing style.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant              true

    Created on : 2018-03-21

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ComponentI
        execute a task on the component after all components have been started; this method is automatically called by the component virtual machine after all components have been started and the component calls in turn its own inner components. Implementations of this method can keep the control as long as they wish (contrary to start) but they need to begin by a call to super if inner components also have an execute method to be called; it is the responsibility of programmers to make sure that this does not provoke deadlocks.

        Contract

         pre    isStarted()
 post   true            // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface ComponentI
        Overrides:
        execute in class AbstractComponent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        AbstractComponent.execute()

      • sumVectorUnitask

        public void sumVectorUnitask​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> vector,
                             AbstractContinuation<java.lang.Double> continuation)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        sum the vector passing the result to the given continuation ; in this example, continuations are called within the same task as the call to sumVectorUnitask.

        Contract

         pre    vector != null and vector.size() >= 1
 pre    continuation != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        vector - vector to be summed.
        continuation - continuation to which the sum is passed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.

      • sumVectorMultitask

        public void sumVectorMultitask​(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Double> vector,
                               AbstractContinuation<java.lang.Double> continuation)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        sum the vector passing the result to the given continuation ; in this example, continuations are called as tasks different from the one of the call to sumVectorUnitask to release the component thread between each call.

        Contract

         pre    vector != null and vector.size() >= 1
 pre    continuation != null
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        vector - vector to be summed.
        continuation - continuation to which the sum is passed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - todo.
